mdscssModel

Class Missile

  • java.lang.Object
    • mdscssModel.Missile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Interceptor, ThreatClassX, ThreatClassY, ThreatClassZ

    public class Missile
extends java.lang.Object
    The Missile object is a Model class that defines a missile and its attributes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Missile

        public Missile(java.lang.String pId,
               Missile.MissileType pType,
               double pFricX,
               double pFricY,
               double pFricZ,
               int pMThrustX,
               int pMThrustY,
               int pMThrustZ)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        pId - The 2-char missile identification string
        pType - The type of the missile (interceptor or Threat)
        pFricX - The friction coefficient in the x direction
        pFricY - The friction coefficient in the Y direction
        pFricZ - The friction coefficient in the Z direction
        pMThrustX - The max acceleration in the x direction
        pMThrustY - The max acceleration in the y direction
        pMThrustZ - The max acceleration in the z direction

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        The getIdentifier function retrieves the id of the missile.
        Returns:
        The 2-char missile identification string

      • getType

        public Missile.MissileType getType()
        The getIdentifier function retrieves the type of the missile.
        Returns:
        The type of missile

      • getPositionVector

        public int[] getPositionVector()
        The getPositionVector function retrieves the position vector of the missile.
        Returns:
        An integer array of size 3 representing the position of the missile in the format of [posX, posY, posZ]

      • getThrustVector

        public int[] getThrustVector()
        The getThrustVector function retrieves the thrust vector of the missile.
        Returns:
        An integer array of size 3 representing the acceleration of the missile in the format of [thrustX, thrustY, thrustZ]

      • getFricVector

        public double[] getFricVector()
        The getFricVector function retrieves the friction coefficient vector of the missile.
        Returns:
        An integer array of size 3 representing the friction coefficients of the missile, in each direction, in the format of [fricX, fricY, fricZ]
